info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers with embedded thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Louisa, Cumberland, Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg, northwestern Nottoway, Goochland, west central Caroline, northwestern Hanover, western Amelia, Powhatan and southeastern Fluvanna Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers with embedded strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cartersville to near Abilene. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Powhatan, Goochland, Cumberland, Farmville, Crewe, Fork Union, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Hadensville, Amelia Courthouse, Cartersville, Burkeville, Columbia, Gum Spring, Oilville, Ferncliff, Tobaccoville, Trenholm and Morven. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
